item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, October 7, 2024 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Can you get root with only a cigarette lighter? (321 points | 74 comments)
2. The Rise of Worse Is Better (1991) (99 points | 112 comments)
3. Show HN: Compiling C in the browser using WebAssembly (52 points | 17 comments)
4. Show HN: Termichess – Play chess in your terminal (32 points | 23 comments)
5. US antitrust case against Amazon to move forward (83 points | 20 comments)
6. The magic (image resampling) kernel (30 points | 1 comment)
7. Longwriter – Increase llama3.1 output to 10k words (64 points | 10 comments)
8. Fukushima Reactor: TEPCO robot aims to extract nuclear fuel (72 points | 42 comments)
9. Unlocking the 'aha' moment: Developer relations for startups (15 points | 1 comment)
10. Substack (YC W18) Is Hiring Machine Learning Engineers ( | hide)
11. Optimizing Postgres table layout for maximum efficiency (6 points | 2 comments)
12. What's New in Ruby on Rails 8 (342 points | 173 comments)
13. Show HN: A Website for Comparing Protein Powder Prices (67 points | 32 comments)
14. Homemade AI Drone Software Finds People When Search and Rescue Teams Can't (104 points | 66 comments)
15. Building a single-page app with Htmx (166 points | 58 comments)

19. NASA Made the Hubble Telescope to Be Remade (78 points | 30 comments)
20. Abacus Machines [pdf] (42 points | 2 comments)

22. AT&T, Verizon reportedly hacked to target US govt wiretapping platform (146 points | 23 comments)
23. Ptxdist – "Professional Embedded Linux Made Easy" (20 points | 7 comments)
24. Silicon Valley, the new lobbying monster (215 points | 214 comments)
25. Show HN: I built a Iridium/LTE satellite GPS tracker and took it to the Arctic (143 points | 22 comments)
26. Nearly all of the Google images results for "baby peacock" are AI generated (246 points | 185 comments)
27. Show HN: ServerlessAI – Build, scale, and monetize AI apps without back end (53 points | 21 comments)
28. Show HN: GoSQL – A query engine in 319 LoC (51 points | 5 comments)
29. How do HTTP servers figure out Content-Length? (224 points | 93 comments)
30. Ask HN: What's the "best" book you've ever read? (197 points | 497 comments)
